intro: Psychotria droissartii, commonly known as the "Congo ghostshade," is a species of flowering plant native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
